title: Iconic Bird of American Horror Stories Faces Its Own Terrifying Fate
excerpt: The Whip-Poor-Will’s shrill, death-proclaiming song populates the works of Stephen King and H.P. Lovecraft. But the bird itself has fallen on hard times. Could it become a ghost of Halloweens past?

title: How the whip-poor-will became an iconic bird of American horror - Fast Company
excerpt: Lovecraft’s and King’s fictional whip-poor-wills draw on widespread Indigenous, European, and American beliefs about the species.
